title: Feature: Generic brokerage downloader wrapper
body:
<!--- Provide a general summary of your changes in the Title above -->

#### Description
<!--- Describe your changes in detail -->
This PR implements a generic `BrokerageDataDownloader` to facilitate downloading historical data from various brokerages using their respective historical providers. The key features include:
1. A new command line argument data-downloader-brokerage to specify the brokerage name when using the generic downloader.
2. Default market names based on the security type if the user does not pass the market name as a parameter. For example:
    - `SecurityType == Equity` defaults to `Market = "USA"`
    - `SecurityType == Crypto` defaults to `Market = "Coinbase"`
    - etc.

#### Related Issue
<!--- This project only accepts pull requests related to open issues -->
<!--- If suggesting a new feature or change, please discuss it in an issue first -->
<!--- If fixing a bug, there should be an issue describing it with steps to reproduce -->
<!--- Please link to the issue here: -->
N/A

#### Motivation and Context
<!--- Why is this change required? What problem does it solve? -->
The motivation behind this implementation is to streamline the process of downloading historical data from different brokerages by creating a generic downloader. This enhancement simplifies the workflow by:
- Reducing the need for multiple specific downloaders for each brokerage.
- Automatically assigning default market names based on the security type, thus reducing manual input and potential errors.

#### Requires Documentation Change
<!--- Please indicate if these changes will require updates to documentation, and if so, specify what changes are required -->
N/A

#### How Has This Been Tested?
<!--- Please describe in detail how you tested your changes. -->
<!--- Include details of your testing environment, and the tests you ran to -->
<!--- see how your change affects other areas of the code, etc. -->
- **Manual Testing**: Manual testing was conducted by running the command line with various brokerage ([TradeStation](https://github.com/quantconnect/Lean.Brokerages.TradeStation) and [Alpaca](https://github.com/quantConnect/Lean.Brokerages.Alpaca)) names and security types to confirm expected behavior.
- **Manual Testing with [lean-cli](https://github.com/quantConnect/Lean-cli)**: build new docker container with this branch and changes.

#### Types of changes
<!--- What types of changes does your code introduce? Put an `x` in all the boxes that apply: -->
- [ ] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] Refactor (non-breaking change which improves implementation)
- [ ] Performance (non-breaking change which improves performance. Please add associated performance test and results)
- [x] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to change)
- [ ] Non-functional change (xml comments/documentation/etc)
